titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Russell Trust Association Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by William Massa and Michael Lotstein

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday April 24, 2019 at 08:43

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: Scanned copies (created in January 2014 and December 2016) of the constitution, 1832, of the Russell Trust Association; contract and architectural plan, 1866; and reminsciences of members, 1884.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is restricted. Written permission of president of organization required.

Original born digital files, as well as preservation masters, may not be accessed due to their fragility. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist request that they be made. Born digital files cannot be accessed remotely. System requirements include a Manuscripts and Archives computer and file viewing software.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Russell Trust Association Records (RU 1135). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by accession.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 40 (YRG 40), Records of Yale clubs, societies, and organizations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scanned copies (created in January 2014 and December 2016) of the constitution, 1832, of the Russell Trust Association; contract and architectural plan, 1866; and reminsciences of members, 1884.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Russell Trust Association is the trade name for the undergraduate senior society, Skull and Bones. The Russell Trust Association was incorporated in 1856 by founding president of Johns Hopkins University, Daniel Coit Gilman. The Russell Trust Association manages the finances of Skull and Bones, which goes towards the upkeep of its properties, associated taxes, and other considerations.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.
